body:
> Hi @setamv thank you for your feedback. Can you try the master branch? I think this bug has been fixed.

ok, i'll try it.

What's wrong with this problem？
i met it

> 1. SingleTableDataNodeLoader

yes, the master branch has fixed the problem. thank you.

> Hi @setamv thank you for your feedback. Can you try the master branch? I think this bug has been fixed.

My i ask when the version 5.0.1 will released? Is there a release plan?
@setamv The 5.1.0 release is currently in progress, you can focus on the mailing list.
Do I need to make other changes?

@strongduanmu this pr only resolve the mysql's problem

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16568907/147638617-013a0462-4e8f-4529-a375-b92e0913459a.png)
the mysql 8.x's code in com.mysql.cj.result.BooleanValueFactory
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16568907/147638729-ee7ab878-b9f9-4bef-934c-1a69948d86d8.png)
postgresql's code in org.postgresql.jdbc.BooleanTypeUtil
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16568907/147638828-de505a75-0c68-4fc9-923d-7cab09db1872.png)
I think the merge engin get value need refactor.
I'm comparing mysql with Postgresql.

Hi @justbk2015 , we've recovered `Column.oldValue` as final field, and also simplified `OpenGaussWalDumper`'s `oldValue` update.

`oldValue` was modified as mutable in PR #12749 before, could you help to verify whether it works on openGauss when you get some time?
I don't think ShardingSphere should support too many type conversions, but you need to prompt the corresponding information.
Hi @SirMin, can you submit a new issue to talk about this discussion?
@Comven can you show the correct configuration, please?

What's the expected result? I check the `AggregationDistinctProjectionSegment`, it remove the parentheses. So if removing the parentheses is enough, I can help to fix this.
I am not sure if we need to change the `innerExpr` to be class `ExpressionSegment`, and in most cases, the concrete class should be `ColumnSegment`
@strongduanmu ok

> Would like to pick up this ticket

@shankeerthan-kasilingam looking forward to you pull request.

Since `ShardingSphereDatabaseMetaData.getActualTableNamePattern` will extend table name pattern, it's not suitable for scaling.
And `ColumnMetaDataLoader` is the kernel of ShardingSphere, it's better not to change it for new scenario.

Workaround: Pipeline metadata loader is recovered and primary key loading is added for scaling.
Hi @KoKo5858, can you translate this issue to english?

@menghaoranss 

In memory / standalone mode, we use JDBC(*cosid-jdbc*) as the back-end storage of machine id. and in cluster mode, we use zookeeper(*cosid-zookeeper*) as the back-end storage. What do you think?
@RaigorJiang could you have a  review ?

This issue seems to be resolved, I will close it. 
If you still have problems, please reopen it or submit a new one.

> @Comven can you show the correct configuration, please?

If read-write separation is used, the database name in `actual-data-nodes` must be configured as the name of the read-write separation group, such as ` db1 order_ info_ 20$->{21..22}0$->{1..9},db1. order_ info_ 'db1 'in 20 $- > {21.. 22} $- > {10.. 12} ` must be configured as' dbgroup'`

The complete configuration is as follows

```
spring.shardingsphere.props.sql-show=true
spring.shardingsphere.datasource.names=db1master,db1slaver

spring.shardingsphere.datasource.db1master.jdbc-url=jdbc:mysql://localhost:3306/sharding_one_master?useUnicode=true&characterEncoding=UTF-8&zeroDateTimeBehavior=convertToNull&useSSL=false&reconnect=true&serverTimezone=Asia/Shanghai
spring.shardingsphere.datasource.db1master.username=root
spring.shardingsphere.datasource.db1master.password=
spring.shardingsphere.datasource.db1master.type=com.zaxxer.hikari.HikariDataSource
spring.shardingsphere.datasource.db1master.driver-class-name=com.mysql.cj.jdbc.Driver

spring.shardingsphere.datasource.db1slaver.jdbc-url=jdbc:mysql://localhost:3306/sharding_one_slaver?useUnicode=true&characterEncoding=UTF-8&zeroDateTimeBehavior=convertToNull&useSSL=false&reconnect=true&serverTimezone=Asia/Shanghai
spring.shardingsphere.datasource.db1slaver.username=root
spring.shardingsphere.datasource.db1slaver.password=
spring.shardingsphere.datasource.db1slaver.type=com.zaxxer.hikari.HikariDataSource
spring.shardingsphere.datasource.db1slaver.driver-class-name=com.mysql.cj.jdbc.Driver

spring.shardingsphere.rules.sharding.tables.order_info.actual-data-nodes=dbgroup.order_info_20$->{21..22}0$->{1..9},dbgroup.order_info_20$->{21..22}$->{10..12}
spring.shardingsphere.rules.sharding.tables.order_info.table-strategy.standard.shardingColumn=add_time
spring.shardingsphere.rules.sharding.tables.order_info.table-strategy.standard.shardingAlgorithmName=tb-month-sharding

# IntervalShardingAlgorithm
spring.shardingsphere.rules.sharding.sharding-algorithms.tb-month-sharding.type=interval
spring.shardingsphere.rules.sharding.sharding-algorithms.tb-month-sharding.props.datetime-interval-amount=1
spring.shardingsphere.rules.sharding.sharding-algorithms.tb-month-sharding.props.datetime-interval-unit=Months
spring.shardingsphere.rules.sharding.sharding-algorithms.tb-month-sharding.props.sharding-suffix-pattern=yyyyMM
spring.shardingsphere.rules.sharding.sharding-algorithms.tb-month-sharding.props.datetime-pattern=yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss
spring.shardingsphere.rules.sharding.sharding-algorithms.tb-month-sharding.props.datetime-lower=2021-06-01 00:00:00
spring.shardingsphere.rules.sharding.sharding-algorithms.tb-month-sharding.props.datetime-upper=2021-08-31 23:59:59

spring.shardingsphere.rules.readwrite-splitting.dataSources.dbgroup.writeDataSourceName=db1master
spring.shardingsphere.rules.readwrite-splitting.dataSources.dbgroup.readDataSourceNames=db1slaver
```

Boolean type conversion differences between mysql 8.x driver and PostgreSQL
the mysql 8.x's code in com.mysql.cj.result.BooleanValueFactory
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16568907/147638729-ee7ab878-b9f9-4bef-934c-1a69948d86d8.png)
postgresql's code in org.postgresql.jdbc.BooleanTypeUtil
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16568907/147638828-de505a75-0c68-4fc9-923d-7cab09db1872.png)
I think the merge engin get value need refactor.
I'm comparing mysql with Postgresql.

From MySQL doc:
```
Important Variables in MySQL 5.6.  Features have been added to MySQL 5.6 which need to be disabled when replicating to earlier MySQL versions. To avoid incompatibilities, set the following variables on the MySQL 5.6 source:
    binlog_checksum=NONE
    binlog_row_image=FULL
    binlog_rows_query_log_events=OFF
    log_bin_use_v1_row_events=1 (NDB Cluster only)
    gtid_mode=OFF 
```

Please refer to these docs for more details:
- [Replication Compatibility Between MySQL Versions](https://docs.oracle.com/cd/E17952_01/mysql-5.6-en/replication-compatibility.html ) , [binlog_row_image](https://docs.oracle.com/cd/E17952_01/mysql-5.6-en/replication-options-binary-log.html#sysvar_binlog_row_image )
- [Merge binlog_row_image from MySQL 5.6](https://jira.mariadb.org/browse/MDEV-6877 )
@564155611 Thank you for your feedback, I will investigate this issue.
Hi @weichaocst, thank you for your feedback. Can you try master branch? We have fixed this bug recently.
You can get the latest jdbc jar from here——http://117.48.121.24:8080/.

Hi @wl4g , from [Sharding Algorithm](https://shardingsphere.apache.org/document/current/en/user-manual/shardingsphere-jdbc/builtin-algorithm/sharding/ ), there's no consistent hash fragmentation strategy for now.

In fact, there're friendly strategies for scaling, e.g. `BOUNDARY_RANGE`. But scale on original database cluster is not implemented for now, it's planned and might be done at next year.

Hi @qianxuwanyu , could you try `metaData.getPrimaryKeys(connection.getCatalog(), connection.getSchema(), tableName)`?

It should work, I've used it on similar scenario. You could refer to [PipelineTableMetaDataLoader.java]( https://github.com/apache/shardingsphere/blob/master/shardingsphere-kernel/shardingsphere-data-pipeline/shardingsphere-data-pipeline-core/src/main/java/org/apache/shardingsphere/data/pipeline/core/metadata/loader/PipelineTableMetaDataLoader.java )

Hi @git-chenhao , when scaling job get done successfully, ShardingSphere will switch metadata (include `dataSources` and `rules`), and connection pool will be refreshed.

You could referto [ScalingRegistrySubscriber.clusterSwitchConfiguration]( https://github.com/apache/shardingsphere/blob/73846fd843cf695285b7951560825786a72d70f2/shardingsphere-mode/shardingsphere-mode-type/shardingsphere-cluster-mode/shardingsphere-cluster-mode-core/src/main/java/org/apache/shardingsphere/mode/manager/cluster/coordinator/registry/cache/subscriber/ScalingRegistrySubscriber.java#L109 ) and [ContextManager.alterDataSourceConfiguration]( https://github.com/apache/shardingsphere/blob/6b7aa50f27a0e3d10a91ef7f2c0d0ac532aee566/shardingsphere-mode/shardingsphere-mode-core/src/main/java/org/apache/shardingsphere/mode/manager/ContextManager.java#L212 ) for more details.

Hi @ShootingFun 
1. Query `PROFILING` is the need for Navicat to display additional information, and does not affect your business SQL
2. Different versions of Navicat behave differently, the tested version will not pop up a dialog box, and there is no additional view;

Due to the large number of third-party clients, ShardingSphere can only be compatible with some of them:
Therefore, it is recommended to check the [FAQ](https://shardingsphere.apache.org/document/current/en/reference/faq/#proxy-how-to-use-a-suitable-database-tools-connecting-shardingsphere-proxy) and choose the recommended version.

“BINLOG_ROW_IMAGE” default value is full. In MySQL 5.5 and earlier, full row images are always used for both before images and after images.
